title: Random password reset email
body:
noreply@riotgames.com
4:50 PM (7 hours ago)

to me 
Greetings Summoner,

Your password has been reset!  Here is your temporary password:

Account: ********************
Password:******************

To finish changing your password, log into the League of Legends community site:

https://www.leagueoflegends.com/account

To change your password, please click on 'My Account' in the top right corner of our website, and then select 'Change Password' from your account management options.

You will need to change your password on the website before logging into PvP.Net.  You cannot change your password from the client.

If you did not request this change, please contact us at support@riotgames.com and we will be able to further assist you.

Thank you!

Riot Games

**Received this email even though I never requested a password change. Been trying to recreate this same email but I am not getting the same results.

When I do it, I get _Riot Games password change request._

Any help or ideas would be great.**

replies.body:
Just got that one changed all my passwords to something a lot harder to brute force. Hope that helps.

How exactly does someone request a temporary password?

If you're getting attempted password resets or finding unauthorized access on your account, our [account recovery](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751694-Recovering-Your-Account) guide can help offer some steps towards recovery.  

If you have any issues accessing the account or updating information, don't worry!  Just hit us up through an [account recovery form](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?ticket_form_id=72416) and our account recovery team will help you individually.  We'll investigate your case and reply back asap!

I got the exact same email. Have not played League in two years. When I tried to login (Not using the email link, manually going to the site) it would not work, had to actually uses the password from the email. When I logged in and checked my match history it showed that someone had played on my account the day of the email for almost 5 hours. Immediately reset my password but if they were able to get in without using the temp password from the email not sure what good it will do.
